Based on the user's preferences, I would recommend "Juno". The movie is about a young woman named Juno who gets pregnant after having sex with a boy she knows. Juno tries to keep the pregnancy secret from her friends and family, but soon finds herself being pursued by her school counselor, Mr. Johnson, who is determined to find out more about Juno's pregnancy, even though he has no right to do so.
The movie also features an excellent performance by Ellen Page as Juno, and a supporting role by Michael Cera as Ben, Juno's ex-boyfriend.
Overall, "Juno" is a well-made movie that offers an interesting and engaging story. It features an excellent performance by Ellen Page, and a supporting role by Michael Cera, which helps to make the movie more enjoyable and compelling.
I would also recommend "Rockshow". The movie is about a young man named Ryan who gets involved in a local band called The Venglers. Ryan tries to help the band get better, but soon finds himself being pursued by his school counselor, Mr. Johnson, who is determined to find out more about Ryan's involvement in the band, even though he has no right to do so.
The movie also features an excellent performance by Hayden Christensen as Ryan, and a supporting role by Kristen Stewart as The Venglers' lead singer, Maria.
Overall, "Rockshow" is a well-made movie that offers an interesting and engaging story. It features an excellent performance by Hayden Christensen, and a supporting role by Kristen Stewart, which helps to make the movie more enjoyable and compelling.
Therefore, based on the user's preferences, I would recommend either "Juno" or "Rockshow". Both of these movies offer interesting and engaging stories, and feature excellent performances by talented actors.

Based on the user's preferences, I would recommend the following movies from the list provided:

1. The Andromeda Strain (1971)
   Plot: A team of scientists work feverishly in a secret, state-of-the-art laboratory to discover what killed the citizens of a small town and how the deadly contagion can be stopped.
   Starring: Paula Kelly, David Wayne, David Wayne, Eric Christmas

2. Her (2013))
   Plot: We live in an era of online dating, open relationships, diverse sexuality preferences and female empowerment but what affects do our generational attributes have on modern dating experiences? This experiential docu- narrative discusses the differences of dating for young single and young committed women today. Interviews express emotions and beliefs which are visually interpreted by male creatives.
   Starring: Kimberly Williams-paisley, Kimberly Williams-paisley, Brian Geraghty, Brian Geraghty, Matthew McConaughey, Matthew McConaughey
